1.name: Copper Shovel
1.description: A sturdy shovel, good for digging up ground.

2.name: Ancient Pickaxe
2.description: Great architects of the lost civilization must have used this to take down almost any wall in their way.

3.name: Copper Pickaxe
3.description: A sturdy tool, well-suited for breaking down walls effortlessly.

4.name: Watering Can
4.description: Used to water seeds and soil.

5.name: Large Watering Can
5.description: Used to water seeds and soil. Holds more water than a regular watering can and covers an area of 2x2 tiles.

10.name: Wood Pickaxe
10.description: A crude tool, useful for breaking down walls.

11.name: Wood Shovel
11.description: A crude shovel, useful for digging up ground.

12.name: Copper Hoe
12.description: A sturdy tool to prepare ground for farming.

15.name: Tin Pickaxe
15.description: A durable tool, good for breaking down walls more easily.

16.name: Tin Shovel
16.description: A durable shovel, well-suited for digging up ground.

17.name: Tin Hoe
17.description: A durable tool to prepare ground for farming.

18.name: Bug Net
18.description: This handy tool allows you to catch tiny critters instead of accidentally stepping on them.

20.name: Iron Pickaxe
20.description: A strong tool, excellent for breaking down harder walls.

21.name: Iron Shovel
21.description: A strong shovel, excellent for digging up ground.

22.name: Iron Hoe
22.description: A strong tool to prepare ground for farming. Covers an area of 2x2 tiles.

30.name: Scarlet Pickaxe
30.description: A great tool for breaking down extremely hard walls.

31.name: Scarlet Hoe
31.description: An excellent tool to prepare ground for farming. Each hit covers an area of 3x3 tiles.

32.name: Scarlet Shovel
32.description: A very robust shovel, exceptional at digging up ground.

35.name: Octarine Pickaxe
35.description: An extraordinary tool for breaking down compact walls.

36.name: Octarine Shovel
36.description: An incredibly versatile shovel, unmatched at digging up ground.

37.name: Galaxite Pickaxe
37.description: An otherwordly tool for breaking down exceptionally hard walls.

38.name: Galaxite Shovel
38.description: An otherwordly shovel, outstanding at digging up ground.

45.name: Soul Seeker
45.description: A successor prototype to the Ancient Mining Pick that had been left unfinished before. In the fires of the Ancient Forge it was now finally completed.

50.name: Wood Fishing Rod
50.description: A crude tool for pulling up fish.

51.name: Tin Fishing Rod
51.description: A durable tool for pulling up bigger fish.

52.name: Iron Fishing Rod
52.description: A strong tool for pulling up rare fish.

53.name: Scarlet Fishing Rod
53.description: A great tool for pulling up very resistant fish.

54.name: Octarine Fishing Rod
54.description: An extraordinary tool for pulling up deep sea fish.

55.name: Galaxite Fishing Rod
55.description: An otherwordly tool for pulling up rare fish. Able to withstand great heat.

70.name: Red Paint Brush
70.description: Used to paint certain objects red.

71.name: Yellow Paint Brush
71.description: Used to paint certain objects yellow.

72.name: Green Paint Brush
72.description: Used to paint certain objects green.

73.name: Purple Paint Brush
73.description: Used to paint certain objects purple.

74.name: Blue Paint Brush
74.description: Used to paint certain objects blue.

75.name: Brown Paint Brush
75.description: Used to paint certain objects brown.

76.name: White Paint Brush
76.description: Used to paint certain objects white

77.name: Black Paint Brush
77.description: Used to paint certain objects black

100.name: Chest
100.description: Useful for storing lots of items. Items can be used while crafting if the chest is placed adjacent to the workbench.

101.name: Larva Hive Chest
101.description: Less like a chest and more like a living organism.

102.name: Mold Covered Chest
102.description: An ancient chest overgrown with white mold.

103.name: Ancient Chest
103.description: This chest seems to be thousands of years old.

104.name: Seashell Chest
104.description: Is it a chest or is it a clam?

105.name: Golden Ancient Chest
105.description: A golden version of the ancient chest which seems to be even older.

106.name: Smoldering Chest
106.description: A container with a fiery crust but its insides are safe for storage.

110.name: Torch
110.description: Light up your surroundings. Can also be placed on the ground.

111.name: Campfire
111.description: Great for huddling together, telling stories and burning marshmallows to a crisp.

112.name: Decorative Torch
112.description: A safer, better-looking alternative to crude torches.

115.name: Crystal Lamp
115.description: This tall torch seems to generate fire from transforming the energy of an ancient gemstone.

120.name: Decorative Pot
120.description: Adding a plant to it will make for a nice decoration.

121.name: Planter Box
121.description: This wide, stone-hewn box holds up three plants for decoration.

127.name: Blue Glass Pedestal
127.description: A stone pedestal with embedded gold and glass, an elegant way to showcase your treasures.

135.name: Wood Stool
135.description: A simple, workable stool made from wood. A true hobbyist might turn this into something more beautiful.

136.name: Wood Table
136.description: A simple, workable table made from wood. A true hobbyist might turn this into something more beautiful.

137.name: Painting
137.description: This framed, blank canvas is just waiting to be turned into a masterpiece.

140.name: Lamp
140.description: Lights up when powered with electricity.

150.name: Large Shiny Glimmering Object
150.description: A crystalline, egg-shaped object. It will catch your eye even from large distances.

151.name: Thumper
151.description: A strange apparatus that sends shockwaves deep into the ground. Using it at the right spot may awaken something from its slumber. Is consumed on successful use.

170.name: Titan's Chest
170.description: A large, ancient chest crested with gemstones.

171.name: Glurch Chest
171.description: A slimy, melting chest that remained from the Abominous Mass.

172.name: Ghorm Chest
172.description: A plated chest reminiscent of the devourer.

173.name: Hive Mother Chest
173.description: This chest is pulsating as if it is alive, a leftover of the Hive Mother.

174.name: Ivy's Chest
174.description: A slime-covered chest reminiscent of the Poisonous Mass.

175.name: Golden Titan's Chest
175.description: A unique variant of the large ancient chest.

176.name: Morpha's Chest
176.description: A slime-covered chest reminiscent of the Aquatic Mass.

177.name: Floating Titan's Chest
177.description: A large, ancient chest crested with gemstones. Through air-filled growths at its bottom it can float on water.

178.name: King Slime's Chest
178.description: A slime-covered chest with golden additions reminiscent of the King Slime.

179.name: Igneous' Chest
179.description: A magma-covered chest reminiscent of the Molten Mass.

180.name: Haunted Hive Mother Chest
180.description: This chest is pulsating as if it is alive, a leftover of the Haunted Hive Mother.

184.name: Desert Prince Chest
184.description: An intricate, unique chest with an orange gemstone locked in its center.

185.name: Desert Queen Chest
185.description: An intricate, unique chest with a green gemstone locked in its center.

186.name: Desert King Chest
186.description: An intricate, unique chest with a purple gemstone locked in its center.

210.name: Locked Copper Chest
210.description: A crude chest made from copper with heavy chains strung around it. It could be opened with the right key.

211.name: Copper Chest
211.description: An crude chest made from copper. It is not locked anymore.

212.name: Copper Key
212.description: A crude key cast in copper. There should be a lock somewhere that it fits into.

213.name: Locked Iron Chest
213.description: An old chest made from iron with heavy chains strung around it. It could be opened with the right key.

214.name: Iron Chest
214.description: An old chest made from iron. It is not locked anymore.

215.name: Iron Key
215.description: An old key cast in iron. There should be a lock somewhere that it fits into.

216.name: Locked Scarlet Chest
216.description: A sturdy chest made from scarlet with heavy chains strung around it. It could be opened with the right key.

217.name: Scarlet Chest
217.description: A sturdy chest made from scarlet. It is not locked anymore.

218.name: Scarlet Key
218.description: A sturdy key cast in scarlet. There should be a lock somewhere that it fits into.

219.name: Locked Octarine Chest
219.description: A clunky chest made from octarine with heavy chains strung around it. It could be opened with the right key.

220.name: Octarine Chest
220.description: A clunky chest made from octarine. It is not locked anymore.

221.name: Octarine Key
221.description: A clunky key cast in octarine. There should be a lock somewhere that it fits into.

222.name: Locked Galaxite Chest
222.description: An indestructible chest made from galaxite with heavy chains strung around it. It could be opened with the right key.

223.name: Galaxite Chest
223.description: An indestructible chest made from galaxite. It is not locked anymore.

224.name: Galaxite Key
224.description: An indestructible key cast in galaxite. There should be a lock somewhere that it fits into.

302.name: Stone Bricks Wall
302.description: A solid wall made with interlocking blocks.

320.name: Wood Wall
320.description: A solid wall made from wood. Works well for building a base.

330.name: City Wall
330.description: A sturdy wall section with golden details and window holes.

331.name: Sandstone Wall
331.description: A rocky wall section with a wavy pattern.

333.name: Temple Wall
333.description: A sturdy wall section made with blue tiles and gold.

334.name: Maze Wall
334.description: An extremely durable wall with an engraved maze pattern.

351.name: Paintable Wall
351.description: A bleak stone wall ready to be turned lively with colors.

352.name: Scarlet Wall
352.description: A reinforced metal wall to set up your base for tough encounters.

354.name: Galaxite Wall
354.description: An otherwordly wall speckled with glittering stars.

404.name: Mold Ground
404.description: An moldy piece of ground that releases infestious spores.

406.name: Clay Ground
406.description: A red, crumbly piece of ground.

407.name: Sand Ground
407.description: A yellow, fragile piece of ground.

408.name: Turf Ground
408.description: A soft, mossy piece of ground.

409.name: City Floor
409.description: A sturdy piece of floor tiled with glass panes and gold.

410.name: Desert Sand Ground
410.description: A beige sandy piece of ground.

412.name: Temple Floor
412.description: A sturdy piece of floor tiled with sandstone and gold.

413.name: Maze Floor
413.description: An extremely durable ground block used in ancient mazes.

1645.name: Larva Meat
1645.description: Only true survivors eat it raw.

1646.name: Shiny Larva Meat
1646.description: Rare, golden variant of larva meat, with increased effects.

2503.name: Giant Slime Summoning Idol
2503.description: Crystal idol to reawaken a Giant Slime. Consumed upon placing it on any Giant Slime summoning rune.

2504.name: Ghorm Summoning Idol
2504.description: Crystal idol to reawaken Ghorm the Devourer. Consumed upon placing it on Ghorm's summoning rune.

2505.name: Hive Mother Summoning Idol
2505.description: Crystal idol to reawaken the Hive Mother. Consumed upon placing it on the Hive Mother's summoning rune.

2506.name: Skull of the Corrupted Shaman
2506.description: A reforged crystal skull that whispers ancient chants. It urges you to place it on the throne room sigil.

2508.name: Crown Summoning Idol
2508.description: A crystal idol that feels out of this world. Consumed upon placing it on any Giant Slime summoning rune.

2509.name: Haunted Hive Mother Summoning Idol
2509.description: Crystal idol to reawaken the Haunted Hive Mother. Consumed upon placing it on the Hive Mother's summoning rune.

3500.name: Yellow Glowbug
3500.description: This flying bug always appears in swarms which appear as dancing lights. Its yellow glow is biome-specific.

3501.name: Blue Glowbug
3501.description: This flying bug always appears in swarms which appear as dancing lights. Its blue glow is biome-specific.

3502.name: Green Glowbug
3502.description: This flying bug always appears in swarms which appear as dancing lights. Its green glow is biome-specific.

3503.name: Red Glowbug
3503.description: This flying bug always appears in swarms which appear as dancing lights. Its red glow is biome-specific.

3901.name: Ancient Hologram Pod
3901.description: A strange device that materializes spirits of the past.

3930.name: Mysterious Idol
3930.description: A crystalline core statue. May attract someone looking for mysterious idols if placed in a habitable room.

3931.name: Slime Oil
3931.description: A jar filled with slime essence, used for beard care. Place it in a habitable room and a bearded character may move in.

3932.name: Pile of chum
3932.description: Undigested remains of prey that could double down as food for fish. Place it in a habitable room and a character interested in fishing may move in.

4003.name: Basic Workbench
4003.description: The most basic of all workbenches.

4004.name: Furnace
4004.description: This standard furnace melts basic metal ores.

4005.name: Electronics Table
4005.description: Workbench to create electrical and logical systems.

4008.name: Alchemist's Table
4008.description: Workbench to tinker with the wonders of chemistry.

4009.name: Table Saw
4009.description: A simple saw to cut materials into slates. Requires electricity.

4010.name: Iron Workbench
4010.description: Essential workbench for survival in the underground.

4011.name: Copper Anvil
4011.description: Get started with creating armor for looks and combat.

4012.name: Jewelry Workbench
4012.description: Workbench for creating rings and necklaces.

4013.name: Cooking Pot
4013.description: Cooking ingredients brings out their full potential. Combine two and see what happens!

4014.name: Iron Anvil
4014.description: Great for creating high tier equipment.

4015.name: Smelter Kiln
4015.description: A kiln that can melt valuable ores.

4016.name: Scarlet Workbench
4016.description: Greater workbench to be prepared for the outer cave systems.

4017.name: Railway Forge
4017.description: Advanced forge to create underground rail systems.

4018.name: Painter's Table
4018.description: Workbench to create a selection of colorful brushes.

4019.name: Tin Workbench
4019.description: A better workbench to prepare you for the underground world.

4020.name: Tin Anvil
4020.description: A better anvil for creating gear and weapons more suited for survival.

4021.name: Scarlet Anvil
4021.description: A very advanced anvil for creating supreme equipment.

4023.name: Cartography Table
4023.description: A table to share your map discoveries with other explorers.

4024.name: Octarine Anvil
4024.description: A strange anvil for creating extraordinary equipment.

4025.name: Salvage and Repair Station
4025.description: Scraps tools and equipment you don't need or refurbishes broken ones.

4026.name: Distillery Table
4026.description: A workbench to produce more advanced potions and explosives.

4027.name: Octarine Workbench
4027.description: Mystical workbench for creating extraordinary gear.

4028.name: Bait Workbench
4028.description: A useful workbench to create all kinds of fishing baits with beneficial effects.

4029.name: Dresser
4029.description: Allows changing the equipment shown on your character.

4030.name: Proficient Jewelry Workbench
4030.description: An advanced workbench for creating rings and necklaces.

4031.name: Boat Workbench
4031.description: This wide workstation allows the construction of different boats. Ahoy!

4032.name: Fury Forge
4032.description: An unstable forge producing incredible heat able to smelt the hardest of metals.

4033.name: Galaxite Workbench
4033.description: Otherwordly workbench that helps tremendously to survive in the deepest caves.

4034.name: Galaxite Anvil
4034.description: A special anvil for creating otherwordly equipment.

4035.name: Key Casting Table
4035.description: A workbench with changeable casting plates to create all kinds of different keys.

4036.name: Go-Kart Workbench
4036.description: A long crafting table to engineer fast vehicles for your travels.

4099.name: Portal
4099.description: Allows teleporting to other portals that have been placed out. The portal takes 20 minutes to charge up before it can be used once it has been placed.

4100.name: Electricity Generator
4100.description: Powers wires and objects with electricity.

4700.name: Wood Floor
4700.description: Simple wooden slats for decorating your base.

4701.name: Wood Fence Gate
4701.description: A simple gate for the wooden fence.

4702.name: Wood Fence
4702.description: A simple fence to protect what's rightfully yours.

4703.name: Wood Bridge
4703.description: Used to cross chasms and water but also makes for a nice floor.

4704.name: Stone Floor
4704.description: Simple rock tiles for decorating your base.

4705.name: Stone Fence Gate
4705.description: A simple gate for the stone fence.

4706.name: Stone Fence
4706.description: A more reinforced fence to protect what's rightfully yours.

4707.name: Stone Bridge
4707.description: Used to cross chasms and water but also makes for a nice floor.

4708.name: Paintable Floor
4708.description: A paintable bleak stone floor to make your base more colorful.

4709.name: Scarlet Floor
4709.description: A reinforced metal floor tile with a nice crimson alloy.

4710.name: Scarlet Fence Gate
4710.description: A tough metal gate for the scarlet fence.

4711.name: Scarlet Fence
4711.description: A reinforced metal fence to protect what's rightfully yours.

4712.name: Scarlet Bridge
4712.description: Used to cross chasms and water but also makes for a nice floor.

4713.name: Lit Floor
4713.description: A plain floor tile that magically lights up by itself. Can be painted and placed under almost every other floor cover.

4714.name: Coral Floor
4714.description: A floor made from little organic tiles and differently colored sea floor pebbles.

4715.name: Coral Fence Gate
4715.description: A fitting gate for the coral fence.

4716.name: Coral Fence
4716.description: A neat little fence made from pink corals.

4717.name: Coral Bridge
4717.description: A shimmering bridge supported by coral pillars that are reaching down into the sea ground.

4718.name: Galaxite Floor
4718.description: An otherwordly floor that feels like walking on the night sky.

4719.name: Galaxite Fence Gate
4719.description: An otherwordly, elegant gate for the galaxite fence.

4720.name: Galaxite Fence
4720.description: An otherwordly, elegant fence for keeping your base safe.

4721.name: Galaxite Bridge
4721.description: An otherwordly bridge that feels like walking on a path through the universe.

4750.name: Rug
4750.description: Cover up the cold ground and make your base cozy.

4751.name: Woven Mat
4751.description: Groundcover made from a net of firm plants.

4752.name: Loose Flooring
4752.description: A collection of workable groundcover made from clay. A true hobbyist might turn them into different shapes and colors.

4760.name: Bed
4760.description: A place to sleep. Also allows friendly inhabitants to move in if placed in a room to their liking.

4770.name: Wood Door
4770.description: Close up your base with this simple door.

4771.name: Stone Door
4771.description: A sturdier door to block out unwanted creatures.

4772.name: Scarlet Door
4772.description: A reinforced door to shut out anyone uninvited.

4773.name: Metal Grate
4773.description: A metal bridge that was used to cross lava in the molten quarry.

5010.name: Caveling Skull
5010.description: Remains of what was once a proud civilization.

5011.name: Leaf Fossil
5011.description: Proof of a once flourishing environment.

5012.name: Ammonite
5012.description: The petrified shell of an ancient sea creature.

5013.name: Geode
5013.description: Half of a rock with beautiful crystals inside.

5016.name: Old Amulet
5016.description: Brittle stone jewelry. Too small to be worn by a human.

5017.name: Ear Plate
5017.description: A squarish earring plated with gold.

5018.name: Bone Creole
5018.description: A crude piece of jewelry carved from bone.

5019.name: Triangle Trinket
5019.description: A strange gold piece vibrating with energy.

5020.name: Twisted Agate
5020.description: A green gem shaped like a spiral.

5021.name: Blood Skull
5021.description: The crimson remains of someone meeting a terrible fate.

5022.name: Grub Knot
5022.description: A mutated lump of small grubs. Disgusting.

5023.name: Petrified Egg
5023.description: Fossilized egg shell, it feels light and brittle.

5024.name: Old Spore Mask
5024.description: An old mask protecting against air-borne spores. It's broken but may still fetch a good price.

5025.name: Hard Thorn
5025.description: A sturdy wooden thorn, someone may have a use for it.

5026.name: Balloon Spore
5026.description: A fluffy giant spore. It's non-toxic but also not very useful.

5027.name: Caveling Doll
5027.description: A handmade doll found in a grave. It must once have belonged to a child...

5028.name: Small Caveling Skull
5028.description: A caveling skull, smaller than usual. It hints at a tragic story.

5029.name: Golden Feather
5029.description: It's big and shiny, a must have for collectors.

5030.name: Mechanical Arm
5030.description: An overgrown piece of ancient technology. The joints are stiff but it must have performed remarkable tasks in the past.

5031.name: Dry Butterfly
5031.description: A dead insect void of any moisture. It is nice to look at but needs to be handled with care.

5032.name: Precious Urn
5032.description: A pretty decorative without any cracks and blemishes but its original contents are long gone.

5033.name: Amber Chunk
5033.description: Solid remains of an ancient forest. The light it reflects is warm and golden.

5034.name: Petrified Coral
5034.description: Grey and porous piece of a giant eco system. The ocean it belonged to seems long gone.

5035.name: Mold Dew
5035.description: Golden-colored dew that emanated from mold spores, maybe someone can find a use for it.

5036.name: Fungal Bone
5036.description: Rotten with mold down to the marrow, its owner must have suffered greatly.

5037.name: Mildew Leaf
5037.description: A leaf with white mold spots on it, apart from that it looks unscathed.

5038.name: Chipped Plate
5038.description: An old stone plate. What kind of food has been served on it?

5039.name: Stone Cap
5039.description: Rock-hard mushrooms attached to a stone slate. They look edible but are actually fossilized.

5040.name: Giant Mite
5040.description: A motionless crimson critter. It just sits there...watching...

5041.name: Rusty Spoon
5041.description: An old, corroded eating utensil. Almost every culture has invented it.

5042.name: Green Kelp
5042.description: A green lump of marine plants, not that useful.

5043.name: Golden Starfish
5043.description: A razorsharp ocean critter polished clean by currents.

5044.name: Amber Fish Egg
5044.description: A perfectly preserved fish egg encapsulated in amber. How those two combined is a mystery.

5045.name: Soft Sponge
5045.description: A soft, squishy sponge. Time to take a bath!

5046.name: Adder Stone
5046.description: A porous smooth stone, some believe it wards off evil spirits.

5047.name: Caveling Perfume
5047.description: A blue fragrance bottle. It is tightly sealed but emits a heavenly scent.

5048.name: Enhydro Crystal
5048.description: Ancient water is encapsulated in this beautiful crystal. It's been in there for millions of years.

5049.name: Mucus Amoeba
5049.description: A slimy giant amoeba, it seems to be looking at you.

5050.name: Parasite Fossil
5050.description: The petrified remains of an ancient parasite, it is uncertain if it's really dead.

5051.name: Golden Cocoon
5051.description: A gold-plated chrysalis, this doesn't seem to be its final form.

5052.name: Grub Pearl
5052.description: Is it a grub-shaped pearl or a pearl-like grub?

5053.name: Giant Germ
5053.description: A big bacterium wiggling around in your hand, fascinating and gross at the same time.

5054.name: Mold Shell
5054.description: The fuzzy, pale housing of a critter that has moved on.

5055.name: Ceremonial Flute
5055.description: An ancient, precious instrument but it is clogged.

5056.name: Data Slate
5056.description: A stone disc with peculiar engravings, it must contain mysterious records.

5057.name: Lost Paddle
5057.description: Somewhere someone must paddle around in circles.

5058.name: Feather Fish Scale
5058.description: Scale of the Feather Fish, it is sturdy but as light as a feather.

5059.name: Caveling Medal
5059.description: Minted medallion with a face relief. Has it been awarded to someone extraordinary once?

5060.name: Rainbow Kelp
5060.description: A super rare mutation of common kelp, showing off a variety of colors.

5061.name: Bubble Pearl
5061.description: A beautiful, iridescent pearl. It seems to be hollow.

5062.name: Black Bubble Pearl
5062.description: A black variant of the bubble pearl, from certain angles it appears golden.

5063.name: Sealed Beverage
5063.description: An unknown liquid slushes inside when shaken. Is there an ancient corkscrew around?

5064.name: Shark Tooth
5064.description: It's as big as the palm of a hand, meeting with a row of those will end up fatal.

5065.name: Forked Coral
5065.description: A trident-shaped coral, not very valuable but nice to look at.

5066.name: Petrified Trilobite
5066.description: The fossil of a long gone critter species. They are ancestors of a big variety of lifeforms.

5067.name: Rusty Fishing Hook
5067.description: Rusted to the core and unusable. That fish was too big to handle, pal.

5068.name: Fish Fossil
5068.description: The imprint of an ancient fish on a rock slate.

5069.name: Fizzy Crystal
5069.description: A bubbly stone that is as clear as water. It weighs almost nothing.

5070.name: Grey Kelp
5070.description: A grey lump of marine plants, not that useful.

5071.name: Yellow Kelp
5071.description: A yellow lump of marine plants, not that useful.

5072.name: Pale Kelp
5072.description: A pale lump of marine plants, not that useful.

5073.name: Red Kelp
5073.description: A red lump of marine plants, not that useful.

5074.name: Early Human Skull
5074.description: Remains of a human that lived about 200.000 years ago. Has mankind found these caves before?

5075.name: Golden Caveling Mask
5075.description: An intricate mask with a stern expression, probably used in a ritual or by someone of high ranks.

5076.name: Ancient Gem Plate
5076.description: This shimmering plate has intricate engravings, it looks like a key to something.

5077.name: Antique Board Game
5077.description: An ancient game for two players, there is no rulebook but apparently it was about shifting blocks around.

5078.name: Music Bowl
5078.description: A precious bowl holding a golden cylinder. It plays a faint, almost melancholic melody.

5079.name: Seismic Clock
5079.description: This broken device looks like it was able to predict earthquakes.

5080.name: Old Journal
5080.description: A leather-bound book with crumbly pages. It is written in familiar letters but a language you don't know.

5082.name: Ritual Goblet
5082.description: An ancient chalice made from stone and gems. Its insides are layered with dark red residue.

5084.name: Glurch Figurine
5084.description: A lifelike representation of Glurch the Abominous Mass.

5085.name: Ivy Figurine
5085.description: A lifelike representation of Ivy the Poisonous Mass.

5086.name: Ghorm Figurine
5086.description: A lifelike representation of Ghorm the Devourer.

5087.name: Hive Mother Figurine
5087.description: A lifelike representation of the Hive Mother.

5088.name: Slime Figurine
5088.description: A lifelike representation of a common Orange Slime.

5089.name: Purple Slime Figurine
5089.description: A lifelike representation of a poisonous Purple Slime.

5090.name: Red Slime Figurine
5090.description: A lifelike representation of an aggressive Red Slime.

5091.name: Acid Larva Figurine
5091.description: A lifelike representation of an Acid Larva.

5092.name: Larva Figurine
5092.description: A lifelike representation of a Larva.

5093.name: Big Larva Figurine
5093.description: A lifelike representation of a Big Larva.

5094.name: Hive Larva Figurine
5094.description: A lifelike representation of a Hive Larva.

5095.name: Big Hive Larva Figurine
5095.description: A lifelike representation of a Big Hive Larva.

5096.name: Caveling Figurine
5096.description: A lifelike representation of a Caveling.

5097.name: Caveling Gardener Figurine
5097.description: A lifelike representation of a Caveling Gardener.

5098.name: Caveling Hunter Figurine
5098.description: A lifelike representation of a Caveling Hunter.

5099.name: Caveling Shaman Figurine
5099.description: A lifelike representation of a Caveling Shaman.

5100.name: Infected Caveling Figurine
5100.description: A lifelike representation of a Infected Caveling.

5101.name: Caveling Brute Figurine
5101.description: A lifelike representation of a Caveling Brute.

5102.name: Azeos Figurine
5102.description: A lifelike representation of Azeos the Sky Titan.

5103.name: Malugaz Figurine
5103.description: A lifelike representation of Malugaz the Corrupted.

5104.name: Tentacle Figurine
5104.description: A lifelike representation of a Tentacle.

5105.name: Mold Tentacle Figurine
5105.description: A lifelike representation of a Mold Tentacle.

5106.name: Snare Plant Figurine
5106.description: A lifelike representation of a Snare Plant.

5107.name: Blue Slime Figurine
5107.description: A lifelike representation of a slippery Blue Slime.

5110.name: Awakened Azeos Figurine
5110.description: A unique lifelike representation of the Awakened Azeos.

5111.name: Screen Device
5111.description: A small device made from blue glass, perfectly fitting into your hand. It's touch sensitive and scrolls through images and glyphs.

5112.name: Caveling Effigy
5112.description: A small depiction of a caveling, it's hollow and must have been used for storing small goods.

5113.name: Crystal Sphere
5113.description: A small orb made from deep-blue glass. It's purpose is unknown.

5114.name: Luxurious Handmirror
5114.description: A hand-held mirror in great condition. Clearly someone had a sense of beauty.

5115.name: Processor Chip
5115.description: This intricate, golden chip seems technically very advanced and must have computed complex calculations.

5116.name: Timeless Hourglass
5116.description: An intact hourglass, filled with blue sand. It is not clear what period of time it measures, as the sand seems to fall incredibly slowly.

5117.name: Playing Dice
5117.description: A playing dice with unique symbols on each face. It's probably been used in sets and for multiple different games.

5118.name: Golden Whistle
5118.description: A small golden whistle with unknown purpose. The sounds it emits is almost unnoticable.

5119.name: Bent Fork
5119.description: A simple fork that has seen too much use.

5120.name: Caveling Cup
5120.description: This small drinking that cup must have held many different beverages. There is still a faint smell of something sweet.

5124.name: Core Figurine
5124.description: A lifelike representation of the core.

5125.name: Morpha Figurine
5125.description: A lifelike representation of Morpha, the Aquatic Mass.

5126.name: Cocoon Figurine
5126.description: A lifelike representation of a cocoon.

5127.name: Omoroth Figurine
5127.description: A lifelike representation of Omoroth, the Sea Titan.

5128.name: Bubble Crab Figurine
5128.description: A lifelike representation of a bubble crab.

5129.name: Core Sentry Figurine
5129.description: A lifelike representation of a core sentry.

5130.name: Caveling Scholar Figurine
5130.description: A lifelike representation of a caveling scholar.

5131.name: Giant Squid Eye
5131.description: A sensory organ of a big sea creature. It probably was lost in a fight to death with something even bigger.

5132.name: Golden Needle
5132.description: This little treasure was used to hold the robe of a caveling scholar in place.

5133.name: Polished Shell
5133.description: A mirror-like smooth shell that was ground down by currents and swirling sand from the sea ground.

5134.name: Opabinia Fossil
5134.description: The petrified body of an prehistoric sea critter. They were one of the first apex predators to appear in the ancient oceans of earth.

5135.name: Blue Kelp
5135.description: A blue lump of marine plants, not that useful.

5136.name: Shrooman Figurine
5136.description: A lifelike representation of a shrooman.

5137.name: King Slime Figurine
5137.description: A lifelike representation of the King Slime.

5141.name: Blue Glass Shard
5141.description: A piece of deep blue glass, it appears to be a fusion of molten sand and ancient gemstones.

5142.name: Charred Caveling Skull
5142.description: A small skull burnt dark to the marrow. Exposure to intense heat for a long time causes something like this to happen.

5143.name: Caveling Sandal
5143.description: This simple footwear is perfect as a protection against hot desert sand. Unfortunately it's too small to be worn by a human.

5144.name: Worker Handcuff
5144.description: Cast from thick metal this tool seemed to be attached to a chain. Has it been used to keep the unlawful from running away?

5145.name: Crystal Spearhead
5145.description: The leftovers of a crude prehistoric weapon made with an ancient gemstone. It may have helped early humans to hunt more effectively.

5146.name: Melting Lava Wing
5146.description: The wing of a lava butterfly, swinging it causes spark to fly off in all directions.

5147.name: Plume Ball
5147.description: A bundle of leaves that grows on plume trees.

5148.name: Pickaxe Head
5148.description: The top part of an iron pickaxe that is partially molten. It must have been broken while working under extreme conditions.

5149.name: Desert Diamond
5149.description: A very rare crystal sparkling with a beautiful white light.

5150.name: Black Desert Diamond
5150.description: The black variant of a desert diamond that is highly sought after by miners. It seems to invert reflected light and cast it back as shadows.

5151.name: Bag of Marbles
5151.description: A small bag holding multiple colored marbles made from glass and cheap gemstones. They have probably been used for child's games.

5152.name: Ancient Golden Coin
5152.description: This coin cast in gold seems to be an much older currency than the common ancient coins. It's also worth a whole lot more.

5153.name: Incense Bowl
5153.description: A porcelain bowl with blue details on the edge and dark residue in its centre. The smell that still lingers around it eases the senses.

5154.name: Ancient Makeup Set
5154.description: A small wooden box containing all kinds of brushes, pastes and powders that have been used for makeup.

5155.name: Caveling Prophet Mask
5155.description: This intricate mask seems to have been worn by an important spiritual figure.

5156.name: Frozen Flame
5156.description: A gemstone that is shaped like crystalline fire.

5160.name: Igneous Figurine
5160.description: A lifelike representation of Igneous, the Molten Mass.

5161.name: Ra-Akar Figurine
5161.description: A lifelike representation of Ra-Akar, the Sand Titan.

5162.name: Bomb Scarab Figurine
5162.description: A lifelike representation of a Bomb Scarab.

5163.name: Lava Butterfly Figurine
5163.description: A lifelike representation of a Lava Butterfly

5164.name: Caveling Assassin Figurine
5164.description: A lifelike representation of a Caveling Assassin

5165.name: Lava Slime Figurine
5165.description: A lifelike representation of a Lava Slime.

5166.name: Broken Gourd
5166.description: A broken container made from clay. It was used to carry rations of water across the desert.

5167.name: Kingfish Scale
5167.description: This beautiful scale seems to belong to a truly extraordinary fish.

5168.name: Broken Toy Ship
5168.description: A leaking wooden ship that is missing its sail.

5169.name: Flesh Kelp
5169.description: A flesh-colored lump of marine plants, not that useful.

5170.name: Ancient Fishing Hook
5170.description: A very old design for a fishing hook that is not used anymore.

5171.name: Fusion Alloy
5171.description: Looks like a failed experiment to create a new type of alloy. It is too hard to be usable in any way.

5172.name: Starlight Shards
5172.description: A collection of sparkling colorful crystals. If they grew natural or not remains a mystery.

5173.name: Dark Blue Kelp
5173.description: A dark blue lump of marine plants, not that useful.

5174.name: White Whistle
5174.description: A rare artifact made from precious, white stone. It doesn't produce a sound when you try to use it.

5175.name: Haunted Hive Mother Figurine
5175.description: A lifelike representation of the Haunted Hivemother.

5176.name: Frankenbrute Figurine
5176.description: A lifelike representation of a Frankenbrute.

5177.name: Pumpking Caveling Figurine
5177.description: A lifelike representation of a Pumpking Caveling.

5178.name: Spookaveling Figurine
5178.description: A lifelike representation of a Spookaveling.

5179.name: Big Dracularva Figurine
5179.description: A lifelike representation of a Big Dracularva.

5180.name: Caveling Skirmisher Figurine
5180.description: A lifelike representation of a Caveling Skirmisher.

5181.name: Caveling Spearman Figurine
5181.description: A lifelike representation of a Caveling Spearman.

5500.name: Mushroom
5500.description: A small cave mushroom, perfect for a snack on the go.

5501.name: Giant Mushroom
5501.description: The king of all mushrooms, growing in perfect conditions made it unusually large.

5505.name: Stone Moss
5505.description: Ground plants found in the Forgotten Ruins. They grow tiny berries that attract cavelings of the corresponding area.

5506.name: Lush Moss
5506.description: Ground plants found in Azeos' Wilderness. They grow tiny berries that attract cavelings of the corresponding area.

5507.name: Urban Moss
5507.description: Ground plants found in the forlorn metropolis. They grow tiny berries that attract cavelings of the corresponding area.

5508.name: Fungal Soil
5508.description: Groundcover interspersed with mycelium. Over time mushrooms and shroomen will grow on it.

5509.name: Valley Moss
5509.description: Ground plants found in the Desert of Beginnings. They grow fragrant flowers that attract cavelings of the corresponding area.

5510.name: Clay Moss
5510.description: Ground plants found in the Clay Caves. They grow aromatic berries that attract cavelings of the corresponding area.

5511.name: Chrysalis
5511.description: Icky groundcover that feels strange to walk across. Larvas will infest chrysalis-covered areas over time.

5512.name: Ground Slime
5512.description: Sticky material that slows down careless adventurers. Slime blobs will start to coagulate from slime covered surfaces over time.

5513.name: Ground Acid Slime
5513.description: Sticky material that slowly dissolves everything that touches it.

5514.name: Ground Poison Slime
5514.description: Sticky material that builds up toxine in the body.

5515.name: Ground Slippery Slime
5515.description: Slick material that makes it difficult to get a steady footing.

5516.name: Ground Magma Slime
5516.description: Sticky material mixed with magma that burns careless explorers.

5520.name: Ancient Crate
5520.description: A mysteriously glowing container holding ancient goods.

5570.name: Ruins Arc
5570.description: A giant stone slate that seemingly was once part of the ceiling. Tremors must have brought it down.

5571.name: Ruins Gate
5571.description: A toppled entrance made from carved stone and ancient gemstones. It seems to have been part of a sprawling city.

5572.name: Ruins Tile
5572.description: This thick stone tile features a pattern that looks like the core. It has been dislodged from the ground.

5573.name: Ruins Pillars
5573.description: Toppled over stone pillars that once supported a very high ceiling. When they fell, they must have caused a lot of destruction.

5601.name: Coloss Cicada Hull
5601.description: The cast-off hull of a giant insect that lives dormant in the ground for centuries. When it emerges to take on its final form, heavy earthquakes occur.

5607.name: Amber Larva
5607.description: Grub encapsulated in amber, an extremely rare ingredient.

5609.name: Hive Growth
5609.description: A vein-like growth that reveals loot when popped open.

5611.name: Wooden Crate
5611.description: A wooden box used by someone to store random goods.

5612.name: Flower Vessel
5612.description: A yellow plant containing organic loot.

5619.name: Bush
5619.description: Stubby patch of grass to use as a decorative.

5620.name: Tall Grass
5620.description: Large patch of tall grass to use as a decorative.

5622.name: Lush Tree
5622.description: This verdant tree spent many years growing in Azeos' Wilderness. Plant it back into the ground to decorate your home.

5624.name: Camp Tent
5624.description: An abandoned makeshift tent, who would have lived here?

5625.name: Camp Matress
5625.description: The resting place of a former adventurer?

5630.name: Mold Vessel
5630.description: A hollow, fuzzy fungus. Breaking it open may yield some useful goods.

5636.name: Overgrown Wooden Crate
5636.description: A box that has been partially reclaimed by nature. It's containing useful goods.

5700.name: Caveling Floor Tile
5700.description: A crumbly stone slab with simple patterns embedded in it.

5701.name: Broken Stone Pillar
5701.description: Unstable pillar for decoration, probably thousands of years old.

5702.name: Caveling Pot
5702.description: An urn made from stone filled with the belongings of cavelings.

5703.name: Caveling Table
5703.description: A crude, blocky piece of furniture, many meals must have been shared on it.

5705.name: Caveling Toilet
5705.description: Between mining there must be time for serious business.

5709.name: Water Well
5709.description: An ancient stone well to take water from.

5710.name: Dark Caveling Floor Tile
5710.description: A dark version of the ancient floor tiles, it looks much older.

5711.name: Caveling throne
5711.description: This unusual seat is proof of an empire fallen to ruin.

5712.name: Roast Firepit
5712.description: Part fireplace, part barbecue it is a great place to huddle together and enjoy some burned pieces of larva meat.

5713.name: Larva Skewer
5713.description: A pretty cruel way of stacking up meat for later use.

5714.name: Larvaskin Tent
5714.description: This simple type of housing must have used many skins of larva. There are patches of other creatures thrown in too.

5715.name: Spear Rack
5715.description: A crudely-made rack that is used by cavelings to have their spears at the ready.

5716.name: Broken Clay Kiln
5716.description: Having seen many years of use this old kiln is beyond repair.

5717.name: Clay Firing Bucket
5717.description: A simple gadget that was used to burn clay and make it harder.

5718.name: Larvaskin Rug
5718.description: This gross rug doubles down as a trophy for the hunted larva that provided their skin.

5719.name: Hive Larvaskin Rug
5719.description: This gross rug doubles down as a trophy for the hunted hive larva that provided their skin.

5720.name: Small Clamping Frame
5720.description: This small wooden frame made use of even the tiniest larva to turn its skin into leather.

5721.name: Clamping Frame
5721.description: This wooden frame has been used to stretch larva skin and manufacture it into leather.

5722.name: Clay Pot
5722.description: A crude container thats already almost broken. Smash it to relieve it of its contents.

5750.name: Mold Tree
5750.description: A once green tree that is thoroughly infected with mold.

5751.name: Mold Well
5751.description: You surely don't want to water your plants with its contents.

5752.name: Mold Pillar
5752.description: An ancient pillar featuring the core, it is overgrown by mold.

5753.name: Mold Cicada
5753.description: A coloss cicada that died before it could cast off its hull. It looks like it got infected with an agressive mold that caused it to run rampage.

5800.name: Beached Jelly
5800.description: A gelatinous creature containing goods from the sea.

5803.name: Land Kelp
5803.description: A type of kelp that can grow outside of water.

5804.name: Tall Land Kelp
5804.description: A large type of kelp that can grow outside of water.

5805.name: Kelp Tree
5805.description: It's technically not a tree but a giant kelp with a double-helix coral as a trunk.

5806.name: Fishing Net Rack
5806.description: A loose net thrown across some stakes to dry in the air.

5807.name: Driftwood Table
5807.description: Someone made this from materials floating in the water.

5808.name: Driftwood Stool
5808.description: A simple stool made with beach materials.

5809.name: Wooden Sign "Core"
5809.description: Driftwood with patterns and carvings showing the Core.

5810.name: Wooden Sign "Tulip"
5810.description: Driftwood with patterns and carvings showing a Glow Tulip.

5819.name: Metropolis Gate
5819.description: An intact stone gate found at the forlorn metropolis. In stands tall and must have dazzled visitors with the giant ancient gemstone in its center.

5820.name: Core Relief Tile
5820.description: A giant, gold-rimmed stone tile, depicting a rendition of the core.

5821.name: Stone tile "Gemstone"
5821.description: A giant stone tile decorated with a deep blue glass. It depicts a glowing gemstone.

5822.name: Stone tile "Cavelings"
5822.description: A giant stone tile decorated with a deep blue glass. It depicts a gathering of cavelings.

5823.name: Stone tile "Scholar"
5823.description: A giant stone tile decorated with a deep blue glass. It depicts a robed caveling.

5824.name: Small Holoboard
5824.description: A vertical panel made from blue glass. The flickering glyphs on it almost appear like a city map.

5825.name: Large Holoboard
5825.description: A vertical large panel made from blue glass. The flickering glyphs on it almost appear like some kind of advertisement.

5826.name: Broken Holoboard
5826.description: A broken panel made from blue glass. It's hard to make out the flickering glyphs on it.

5827.name: Big Gold-edged Table
5827.description: A big sturdy table hewn from a giant stone slab. There is a lot of space for many people.

5828.name: Gold-edged Table
5828.description: A sturdy table hewn from a giant stone slab. There is a lot of space for many people.

5829.name: Caveling Stool
5829.description: This stool is made from solid stone but has a comfortable cushion embedded.

5830.name: Stone Shelf
5830.description: A solid shelf with lots of space for books and scrolls. The ones left in it are unintelligible.

5831.name: Large Stone Shelf
5831.description: A large solid shelf with lots of space for books and scrolls. The ones left in it are written in a language you don't speak.

5832.name: Caveling Fireplace
5832.description: A solid fireplace with heavy mantle. It burns with a strange fire that exits from a gemstone in it's bottom.

5833.name: Caveling Pillar
5833.description: A broad stone pillar, depicting an abstract caveling.

5834.name: Vending Machine
5834.description: An old, still functioning automaton that is proof of advanced technology and a sophisticated society.

5835.name: Broken Vending Machine
5835.description: A broken automaton that once contained snacks and other goods. It looks like it was forced open.

5840.name: Metropolis Crate
5840.description: This precious container holds useful items that have been used by citizens of the ancient city.

5842.name: Driftwood Wooden Crate
5842.description: This box has been created from driftwood and is bleached by light from above.

5860.name: Desert Flower Vessel
5860.description: A dry plant containing natural loot from the desert.

5863.name: Charred Crate
5863.description: This wooden crate has been blackened by a scorching environment.

5864.name: Temple Crate
5864.description: An ancient crate filled with goods of an old desert civilization.

5866.name: Oasis Flower Vessel
5866.description: A healthy plant containing natural loot from the desert.

5868.name: Desert Shrub
5868.description: A dry bush that can live hundreds of years without water.

5870.name: Large Left-Facing Rock Arc
5870.description: A large sandstone arc, you're not exactly sure how it fits in your backpack.

5871.name: Giant Right-Facing Rock Arc
5871.description: A giant sandstone arc, you're not exactly sure how it fits in your backpack.

5874.name: Plume Tree
5874.description: This tree has rock-hard bark and deep roots to gain and hold water from the desert grounds. Its leaves grow in puffy bundles.

5881.name: Temple Pillar
5881.description: A very beautiful, decorative pillar only found in ancient desert temples.

5882.name: Angled Glyph Wall
5882.description: An ancient sandstone wall with an angled top and covered in indecipherable glyphs. What stories do they tell?

5883.name: Glyph Wall
5883.description: An ancient sandstone wall covered in indecipherable glyphs. What stories do they tell?

5884.name: Temple Decor Rug
5884.description: A small, ancient rug caked with the dust of thousands of years. The design on it shows a trinity of eyes.

5885.name: Large Temple Decor Rug
5885.description: A large, ancient rug with a very detailed design woven into it. It must once have been an expensive item and a sign of prosperity.

5886.name: Temple Guardian Statue
5886.description: This intimidating statue depicts an ancient guardian in exotic garment. Its kneeling pose hints at being in service of a king.

5887.name: Raided Temple Guardian Statue
5887.description: A statue wilfully destroyed by grave thiefs. It has been partially relieved of the green daggers in its stony clasp.

5888.name: Glyph Stele
5888.description: A block made from hazy blue glass with golden etchings. It seems like these were used as memorials or to mark places of importance.

5889.name: Broken Glyph Stele
5889.description: A block made from hazy blue glass with golden etchings. The information written on it is lost forever as it has been smashed on purpose.

5900.name: Temple Throne
5900.description: A golden throne reserved only for the buttocks of ancient royalty.

5901.name: Temple Pedestal
5901.description: An ancient golden stand that seems to have held royal belongings once.

5902.name: Azeos Urn
5902.description: This decorative vase has been made in honor of Azeos, the Sky Titan.

5903.name: Ra-Akar Urn
5903.description: This decorative vase has been made in honor of Ra-Akar, the Sand Titan.

5904.name: Omoroth Urn
5904.description: This decorative vase has been made in honor of Omoroth, the Sea Titan.

5908.name: Raided Grave
5908.description: Its emptiness is proof of the blasphemous acts of grave raiders.

5909.name: Damaged Grave
5909.description: A partially broken grave that either survived the currents of time or a quick attempt to gain treasure.

5910.name: Servant Grave
5910.description: This grave made from stone shows the relief of an ancient caveling in service of the kingdom that once persisted in the desert.

5911.name: Tilted Grave
5911.description: An empty grave that has been moved out of its alignment in search for valuables.

5916.name: Lava Rock
5916.description: You're not sure why you did this...but at least you now have a very hot rock.

5917.name: Coal Pit
5917.description: The ashen remains in it hint at it once being used to harden metals in its fires over a long period of time.

5918.name: Old Smithing Bellow
5918.description: An old device used to circulate air into a forge to create extreme temperatures. The lever for its mechanism is rusted in place.

5919.name: Broken Quarry Timber
5919.description: One half of a broken wooden construction that seemed to have once held something in place.

5920.name: Large Quarry Timber
5920.description: A wooden construction used to keep ore and rocks above a fire. A surge in temperatures rendered it unusable.

5921.name: Old Wheelbarrow
5921.description: A broken wheelbarrow stuck in its own molten contents. It seems like it couldn't withstand the extreme heat.

5922.name: Large Right-Facing Rock Arc
5922.description: A large sandstone arc, you're not exactly sure how it fits in your backpack.

5923.name: Giant Left-Facing Rock Arc
5923.description: A giant sandstone arc, you're not exactly sure how it fits in your backpack.

6002.name: Tombstone
6002.description: Now that the worst is over, use it to decorate!

6500.name: Lever
6500.description: Generates a low amount of electricity that can be turned on and off.

6501.name: Electrical Wire
6501.description: Connects sources of electricity to machines and apparatuses.

6504.name: Electrical Door
6504.description: Opens up when powered with electricity.

6505.name: Logic Circuit
6505.description: Electricity can move through the circuit when it receives electricity on exactly 2 out of 3 inputs.

6506.name: Pulse Circuit
6506.description: Electricity moves through in intervals of 1 second.

6507.name: Delay Circuit
6507.description: Stores electricity input and sends it out during intervals of 1 second.

6508.name: Electricity Stick
6508.description: Emits a very low electricity that is too low to power up objects but useful to change behavior of logic circuits.

6509.name: Dynamite Pack
6509.description: This tight pack of explosives can be detonated in safety with an external trigger.

6510.name: Pressure Plate
6510.description: Generates a low amount of electricity when stepped on by the player.

6511.name: Cross Circuit
6511.description: Separates horizontal and vertical wires. Useful to allow crossing wires without connecting the electricity. Direction of connections can be changed by interacting with the circuit.

6550.name: Rail
6550.description: Traverse the underground world much faster.

6581.name: Speeder
6581.description: Allows travelling over water much faster.

6590.name: Speeder Go-kart
6590.description: A racing kart with a nice red finish, able to outrace other vehicles after a longer acceleration time. Tends to drift a lot when driving too fast.

6591.name: Renegade Go-kart
6591.description: An off-road vehicle that provides quick acceleration but lower top-speed. It looks slightly busted but lets you take curves in a more stable manner.

6592.name: Primitive Go-kart
6592.description: An ancient vehicle built by the lost civilization, seemingly for pure fun. It provides only a fraction of the speed it once was capable of.

6600.name: Hive Spike Trap
6600.description: A larva hive trap made out of sharp bones, damaging any creature who steps on it.

6601.name: Spike Trap
6601.description: A mechanical spike trap that only reacts to enemies.

6604.name: Poison Spike Trap
6604.description: A mechanical spike trap that reacts to anyone stepping on it and additionally applies poison when inflicting damage.

6609.name: Galaxite Trap
6609.description: This high-tech trap shoots out a jet of energy that burns with different temperatures, resulting in a rainbow flame.

6650.name: Drill
6650.description: Can slowly drill through tougher materials such as ore boulders when powered with electricity.

6652.name: Robot Arm
6652.description: Mechanical helping hand, grabs things and puts them elsewhere when powered with electricity.

6653.name: Sprinkler
6653.description: A useful gadget that waters tilled ground in a small radius.

6654.name: Stone Turret
6654.description: This ancient trap shoots projectiles at anyone walking into its line of sight. Its inner workings are concealed by a caveling grimace.

6655.name: Galaxite Turret
6655.description: An automated high-tech gun that shoots enemies it faces with energy projectiles. Requires electricity to function.

7100.name: Azeos Feather Fan
7100.description: A beautiful fan created in honor of Azeos that appears to create wind without swinging it. A gift worthy of a queen.

7200.name: Omoroth Compass
7200.description: A splendid tool for seafaring created in honor of Omoroth, anyone possessing it will never feel lost at sea. A gift worthy of a king.

7300.name: Ra-Akar Automaton
7300.description: A complex wind-up machine created in honor of Ra-Akar that seems to have a mind of its own. A gift worthy of a young prince.

8001.name: Heart Berry Seed
8001.description: Grows into a healthy fruit when planted.

8003.name: Heart Berry
8003.description: A sweet, juicy berry that refreshes the body.

8004.name: Glow Tulip Seed
8004.description: Grows into a luminescent flower when planted.

8006.name: Glow Tulip
8006.description: A precious, shimmering flower that absorbed ancient energy.

8007.name: Bomb Pepper Seed
8007.description: Grows into a spicy vegetable when planted.

8009.name: Bomb Pepper
8009.description: A fierce vegetable for spicing up foods.

8010.name: Carrock Seed
8010.description: A tough seed that only grows in stone.

8012.name: Carrock
8012.description: Rock-hard vegetable that toughens you up.

8013.name: Puffungi Seed
8013.description: A seed that only grows in mold.

8015.name: Puffungi
8015.description: A moldy fungus fit for gourmets.

8016.name: Root Seed
8016.description: Once planted it spreads roots in every direction.

8018.name: Grub Kapok Seed
8018.description: Turns into a plant that gives fiber when harvested.

8020.name: Coral Seed
8020.description: Once planted it spreads corals in every direction. Only grows on beach sand.

8022.name: Bloat Oat Seed
8022.description: Grows into a filling crop when planted.

8024.name: Bloat Oat
8024.description: A handful of healthy cereal that fills you up and gives you energy.

8025.name: Pewpaya Seed
8025.description: Grows into a juicy fruit when planted in beach sand.

8027.name: Pewpaya
8027.description: A juicy, sweet fruit that clears your mind and raises focus.

8028.name: Pinegrapple Seed
8028.description: Grows into a refreshing sour and sweet fruit when planted in beach sand.

8030.name: Pinegrapple
8030.description: An intensely tasty fruit that has you clench your weapons tightly.

8031.name: Grumpkin Seed
8031.description: Grows into a lumpy fruit when planted.

8033.name: Grumpkin
8033.description: A lumpy vegetable that looks very annoyed with having been pulled from the soil.

8100.name: Golden Heart Berry
8100.description: A very rare variant of the common heart berry.

8101.name: Golden Glow Tulip
8101.description: A very rare variant of the common glow tulip.

8102.name: Golden Bomb Pepper
8102.description: A very rare variant of the common bomb pepper.

8103.name: Golden Carrock
8103.description: A very rare variant of the common carrock.

8104.name: Golden Puffungi
8104.description: A very rare variant of the common puffungi.

8105.name: Golden Bloat Oat
8105.description: A very rare variant of the common bloat oat.

8106.name: Golden Pewpaya
8106.description: A very rare variant of the common pewpaya.

8107.name: Golden Pinegrapple
8107.description: A very rare variant of the common pinegrapple.

8108.name: Golden Grumpkin
8108.description: A very rare variant of the common grumpkin.

8200.name: Recall Idol
8200.description: Teleports you back to the core, consumed in the process.

8210.name: Hive Mother scanner
8210.description: Scans the world for the Hive Mother. Consumed on successful scan.

8211.name: Ghorm the Devourer Scanner
8211.description: Scans the world for Ghorm the Devourer. Consumed on successful scan.

8220.name: Azeos the Sky Titan Scanner
8220.description: Scans the world for Azeos the Sky Titan. Consumed on successful scan.

8221.name: Ivy the Poisonous Mass Scanner
8221.description: Scans the world for Ivy the Poisonous Mass. Consumed on successful scan.

8225.name: Omoroth the Sea Titan Scanner
8225.description: Scans the world for Omoroth the Sea Titan. Consumed on successful scan.

8226.name: Morpha the Aquatic Mass Scanner
8226.description: Scans the world for Morpha the Aquatic Mass. Consumed on successful scan.

8227.name: Ra-Akar the Sand Titan Scanner
8227.description: Scans the world for Ra-Akar the Sand Titan. Consumed on successful scan.

8228.name: Igneous the Molten Mass Scanner
8228.description: Scans the world for Igneous the Molten Mass. Consumed on successful scan.

8250.name: Rune Parchment
8250.description: A unusually well preserved piece of ancient paper. The runes are impossible to decipher but small symbols hint at it being the recipe for a strange weapon.

8251.name: Glyph Parchment
8251.description: A unusually well preserved piece of ancient paper. There are glyphs and images on it that show how to forge a powerful ancient weapon.

8252.name: Empty Crystal
8252.description: A rhombus-shaped crystal made from glass that has complex circuits embedded. It seems powered down, maybe it could be fed data to activate it again?

8253.name: Admin Key
8253.description: A reactivated key belonging to a wise leader. It may open the door to something very valuable.

8254.name: Cipher Parchment
8254.description: An unusually well preserved scroll made from golden paper. Among the blue edged runes are drawings of an ancient forge resembling the face of a caveling.

8255.name: Thread of Fate
8255.description: A mysterious string woven from fine filaments. It can be used to bind a set of cards together.

8300.name: Lantern
8300.description: A small, useful light that leaves your main hand free.

8301.name: Orb Lantern
8301.description: A better, brighter version of off-hand light to carry around.

8302.name: Small Lantern
8302.description: A weak light to be carried in the off-hand.

8303.name: Pumpkin Lantern
8303.description: A scary, yet cozy lantern carved from a vegetable. Don't smash it, it brings bad luck.

8320.name: Wooden Shield
8320.description: A useful off-hand item to block hits from enemies.

8321.name: Toxic Defender
8321.description: A shield covered in toxic grime. Has a chance to poison enemies when blocking attacks.

8322.name: Octarine Shield
8322.description: An extremely durable shield infused with energy that increases health while holding it.

8340.name: Swift Feather
8340.description: A mysterious feather that allows you to dash out of danger.

8341.name: Azeos' Dash Feather
8341.description: A colorful talon feather from Azeos, the Sky Titan. By holding it you can dash at a high speed.

8350.name: Blue Leather Tome
8350.description: An ancient book with stitched blue covers. Is that skin?

8351.name: Golden Jellyfish
8351.description: This rare jellyfish seems to do well without water and apparently it likes your company.

8352.name: Caveling ID
8352.description: A sturdy card that once belonged to a citizen of the forlorn metropolis. It's thousand of years old but the excellent print hasn't faded.

8353.name: Turtle Shell
8353.description: A hard shell that once belonged to a graceful sea creature. You feel much more protected when holding it.

8354.name: Omoroth's Beak
8354.description: The sharp mouth piece of Omoroth, the Sea Titan. It seems to be able to crush every material.

8355.name: Sentry Shield
8355.description: The discarded breast piece of a core sentry. It has just the right size to be used as a great shield and the ancient gemstone in its center sometimes shoots out energy as it blocks enemy attacks.

8356.name: Royal Gel
8356.description: A blob of slime with a tiny crown in its center. With the right headpiece you can reign over all slimes.

8357.name: Crystal Meteor Chunk
8357.description: A very big ancient gemstone fused from smaller shards. It emits a strange energy that makes you feel nauseous and feverish.

8358.name: Scorching Aegis
8358.description: The crust of molten rock, formed to be wielded like a shield.

8359.name: Concealed Blade
8359.description: A knife attached to a wrist band hidden among layers of fabric. It's perfect for an unsuspected stealth attack.

8360.name: Smithing Glove
8360.description: Reinforced with several rare materials, this glove can withstand great heat and is a must have for every experienced blacksmith.

8361.name: Oracle Deck
8361.description: The complete set of oracle cards. Bringing them together strangely restored the cards to perfect condition and now they emit a powerful, enlightening aura.

8362.name: Core Iris
8362.description: A manufactured crystal that looks like the eye of the core. This one is raw and unfinished, as if something interrupted the process.

8380.name: Spicy Bait
8380.description: A well-seasoned type of bait that attracts fish more quickly.

8381.name: Sweet Bait
8381.description: A sugary type of bait that increases the chance of catching fish instead of loot.

8382.name: Glowing Bait
8382.description: A luminous type of bait that increases the chance of pulling up loot.

8383.name: Sticky Bait
8383.description: An icky type of bait that pulls fish closer before they even bite.

8384.name: Expert Lure
8384.description: This lure consists of multiple edible and magical components, attracting the one big catch that lingers in deep waters. Is consumed on successful use.

8385.name: Purple Bait
8385.description: A shimmering bait that catches the eye of more rare fish.

8386.name: Green Bait
8386.description: A pointy bait that can stick to fish from the outside to catch more and catch them faster.

8387.name: Red Bait
8387.description: A wiggly bait that looks like a red worm, quickly drawing fish closer to you before they bite.

8400.name: Cave Pouch
8400.description: Every underground miner needs one of those!

8401.name: Ghorm's Stomach Bag
8401.description: A well-preserved stomach portion of the Devourer, comes with a handy strap.

8402.name: Scarlet Shell Backpack
8402.description: A hard-case backpack with lots of space and additional protection.

8403.name: Explorer Backpack
8403.description: A simple backpack made for traveling the underground caves. Holds quite a few items.

8404.name: Octarine Bag
8404.description: A strange bag that has more space inside than it looks like from the outside.

8405.name: Morpha's Bubble Bag
8405.description: An elastic bag with lot's of space that formed from one of Morpha's outer growths.

8500.name: Copper Helm
8500.description: Resembles more of a bucket but repels strong blows to the head.

8501.name: Wood Helm
8501.description: Slight protection for the head but you should look for better options soon.

8502.name: Peasant Hat
8502.description: Simple leather hat, doesn't look that great but does its job.

8503.name: Caveling Hood
8503.description: Light armor hood that hides the face.

8504.name: Iron Helm
8504.description: Tough helm fit for knights. Comes with a visor and a flamboyant plume.

8505.name: Bronze Helm
8505.description: This helm repels slight blows to the head.

8509.name: Carapace Helm
8509.description: A chitin-plated head piece, wearing it fills you with the urge to dig paths through the darkness.

8510.name: Larva Helm
8510.description: No need for fancy hats. Just grub.

8511.name: Scarlet Helm
8511.description: Menacing-looking horned helm, fits perfectly with the rest of the set.

8512.name: Hunter Hood
8512.description: This hood is made from big leaves tucked into a headband. Lets you blend into green environments.

8513.name: Farmer's Hat
8513.description: Tuck a straw in your mouth and get ready for a whole day of relaxing on the porch.

8514.name: Octarine Helm
8514.description: A strange headgear with no visor. For some reason you can still see clearly when putting it on.

8515.name: Radical Rabbit Ears
8515.description: A cute hood featuring white rabbit ears. You feel quite cheeky and swift wearing it.

8516.name: Scholar's Hood
8516.description: A strange hood made from white linen and gold, in its shade you feel more intelligent than usual.

8517.name: Diving Helm
8517.description: This heavy chunk of metal was used to explore deep waters, unfortunately it's leaking now. Still works as a nice armor piece.

8518.name: Slime Helm
8518.description: A gooey, constantly dripping helm that covers half of your face.

8519.name: Sentry Helm
8519.description: The detached head of a core sentry. Wearing it feels incredibly clunky and heavy but it makes up for it with great protection.

8520.name: Sunglasses
8520.description: Nothing is more important than sporting cool sunglasses, even when it's dark.

8521.name: Omoroth's Helm
8521.description: An iron-cast helm with a scary grimace and potruding tentacles.

8522.name: King Slime Crown
8522.description: A rare headpiece that crowns you as king of all slimes. You feel very royal wearing it.

8523.name: Galaxite Helm
8523.description: A futuristic helmet fit for a space explorer. Looking through its visor is like looking into the depths of the universe.

8524.name: Assassin Hood
8524.description: A mysterious hood for true desert dwellers that keeps the face in shade.

8525.name: Magma Horn Armor
8525.description: A pretty awesome piece of equipment that makes you look like the harbinger of doom.

8526.name: Scarab Visor
8526.description: A helm made in the design of Ra-Akar, casting it's central eye on your enemies.

8527.name: Miner's Protective Helm
8527.description: A handy helm with integrated goggles and a still functioning headlamp.

8528.name: Paladin Mask
8528.description: A mysterious piece of equipment with a golden mask. It seems to have been granted to warriors of high rank.

8529.name: Pumpkin Head
8529.description: A vegetable head with a carved-in face. For how disgusting it feels from the inside, it looks pretty cool on the outside.

8530.name: Spooky Blanket Hood
8530.description: A cheap last-minute attempt to get ready for the spooky season.

8531.name: Frankenbrute Head
8531.description: Put more head on your head. Doesn't necessarily add up to more brain, though.

8532.name: Godsent King Mask
8532.description: A unique, royal piece of armor resembling the head of the state, crowning it as a descendant of the gods. It was intended for a future that never came.

8533.name: Skirmisher Cap
8533.description: A headpiece worn by caveling skirmishers which has been cobbled together with larvaskin, leaves and dirty cloth.

8600.name: Copper Breastplate
8600.description: Got no sixpack? Just craft one!

8601.name: Wood Chest
8601.description: Very crude armor for the upper body. Offers minor protection.

8602.name: Peasant Chest
8602.description: A simple makeshift armor for the upper body.

8603.name: Caveling Chest
8603.description: Made from grub leather, good for unhindered movement in combat.

8604.name: Iron Breastplate
8604.description: Charge into battle with this epic chest piece.

8605.name: Bronze Breastplate
8605.description: A good armor to survive battles more easily.

8609.name: Carapace Breastplate
8609.description: An organic body armor resembling Ghorm's shell, it is heavy and feels weird on the inside.

8610.name: Larva Chest
8610.description: Don't be anything else. Be grub.

8611.name: Scarlet Breastplate
8611.description: Fierce upper body armor for true warriors.

8612.name: Hunter Cloak
8612.description: A cloak crafted from big leaves woven together. Makes you look like a walking bush.

8613.name: Ivy's Thorn Harness
8613.description: This organic breastplate armor is crested with thorns, allowing for stronger critical hits.

8614.name: Octarine Breastplate
8614.description: This mysterious breastplate stimulates the muscles to swing your weapon much faster.

8615.name: Scholar's Cloak
8615.description: A magically-imbued piece of cloth, worn by caveling scholars. Wearing it you feel in tune with the ancients.

8616.name: Kelp Mantle
8616.description: An upper body armor made from long kelp strands. Now you feel like a real creature of the sea.

8617.name: Slime Armor
8617.description: A gelatinous upper body armor that looks like someone dumped a bucket of goo onto you.

8618.name: Towel
8618.description: A towel is about the most massively useful thing an underground miner can have.

8619.name: Green Bikini Top
8619.description: A green swim suit piece that keeps everything in its place. Everyone knows the most revealing armor is the most protective.

8620.name: Blue Bikini Top
8620.description: A blue swim suit piece that keeps everything in its place. Everyone knows the most revealing armor is the most protective.

8621.name: Red Bikini Top
8621.description: A red swim suit piece that keeps everything in its place. Everyone knows the most revealing armor is the most protective.

8622.name: Omoroth's Chestplate
8622.description: A upper body armor reminiscent of the Sea Titan. There is a sleek cape attached to it.

8623.name: Galaxite Torso
8623.description: A futuristic protection for the upper body. Its intimidating yet elegant design is a true marvel to look at.

8624.name: Assassin Cloak
8624.description: This multi-layered piece of fabric is tightly woven to keep the body cool and protect from coarse, grainy sand.

8625.name: Magma Torso Armor
8625.description: This fiery armor is almost too hot to handle but becomes well-tempered when worn.

8626.name: Scarab Harness
8626.description: A masterfully crafted upper body armor to endure the dangers of the desert.

8627.name: Miner's Labour Suit
8627.description: An airtight zip-up suit for working in deep caverns. The flashy orange makes it official.

8628.name: Paladin Harness
8628.description: A golden breastplate with loose fabric sewn to it that makes you feel like a stealthy warrior of the desert.

8630.name: Dracularva Cape
8630.description: A black satin cape fit for a vampire. The crimson flip-up collar adds to the evil look.

8631.name: Godsent King Breast Armor
8631.description: A unique, royal piece of armor resembling the heart of the state. Golden wings were added to inherit the grace of Azeos. Before it could be used, the kingdom crumbled to dust from the inside.

8701.name: Wood Pants
8701.description: The next best thing when it comes to lower body armor.

8703.name: Caveling Pants
8703.description: These pants don't cover much but make your movement more elusive.

8706.name: Scarlet Pants
8706.description: March through your enemies and don't look back.

8707.name: Ivy's Pants
8707.description: Lower body armor naturally grown in the underground jungle, featuring thorned kneecaps.

8708.name: Octarine Pants
8708.description: This peculiar leg protection phases energy through your whole body.

8709.name: Scuba Fins
8709.description: Squeaky footwear made from a rubber-like material. It's uncomfortably wet.

8710.name: Green Board Shorts
8710.description: Wearing those chill green shorts tempts you to constantly form the shaka sign with your hand.

8711.name: Blue Board Shorts
8711.description: Wearing those chill blue shorts tempts you to constantly form the shaka sign with your hand.

8712.name: Red Board Shorts
8712.description: Wearing those chill red shorts tempts you to constantly form the shaka sign with your hand.

8713.name: Green Bikini Bottom
8713.description: A green underwear piece that goes well with its top part. Get rid of unnecessary clothing and run free in the sun!

8714.name: Blue Bikini Bottom
8714.description: A blue underwear piece that goes well with its top part. Get rid of unnecessary clothing and run free in the sun!

8715.name: Red Bikini Bottom
8715.description: A red underwear piece that goes well with its top part. Get rid of unnecessary clothing and run free in the sun!

8716.name: Omoroth's Leg Armor
8716.description: Delicately decorated leg protection that's constantly wet. Looks cool but is very uncomfortable to wear.

8717.name: Galaxite Pants
8717.description: A futuristic armor for the lower body. It makes you feel like every small step you take is a giant leap for mankind.

8718.name: Magma Shin Armor
8718.description: A melting leg armor made from liquid stone, giving hot legs a whole new definition.

8719.name: Scarab Legs
8719.description: A lower body armor mimicking the properties of desert critters.

8720.name: Miner's Worker Pants
8720.description: Well-fitting pants that make traversing the underground much more convenient. Comes with squeaky rubber boots.

8721.name: Paladin Pants
8721.description: Wide harem pants made for fighting, coupled with a set of pointy golden shoes.

8722.name: Godsent King Pants Armor
8722.description: A unique, royal piece of armor resembling the heir of the state, which was supposed to carry the glory of the kingdom when inheriting the throne. A dark prophecy and act of assassination ended the royal line.

8800.name: Copper Cross Necklace
8800.description: This pendant sharpens the focus, allowing for more precise hits.

8801.name: Grub Egg Necklace
8801.description: This odd necklace seems to have a life of its own.

8802.name: Iron Chunk Necklace
8802.description: A heavy piece of jewelry that increases defence.

8803.name: Heart Berry Necklace
8803.description: A heart berry on the neck makes for an easy snack!

8804.name: Ammonite Necklace
8804.description: Simple but beautiful necklace featuring a fossil.

8805.name: Gold Crystal Necklace
8805.description: A shiny trinket combining the most valuable of materials.

8806.name: Blob Rosary Necklace
8806.description: Sticky necklace infused with energy made for an unknown purpose.

8807.name: Azeos Beak Necklace
8807.description: Forged from a piece of the sky titan's beak.

8808.name: Remedaisy Necklace
8808.description: Jewelry made from a rare plant that repels poison.

8809.name: Ancient Guardian Necklace
8809.description: A truly powerful relic of the past, made for fending off the strongest of foes.

8810.name: Mold Vein Necklace
8810.description: A circle of white organic filaments, it latches onto the skin.

8811.name: Cave Guppy Necklace
8811.description: Odd necklace made from a fish that never let go of the hook.

8812.name: Bubble Pearl Necklace
8812.description: Natural grown jewelry made from rare bubble pearls.

8813.name: Polished Copper Cross Necklace
8813.description: This pendant sharpens the focus, allowing for more precise hits.

8814.name: Polished Iron Chunk Necklace
8814.description: A heavy piece of jewelry that increases defence.

8815.name: Polished Gold Crystal Necklace
8815.description: A shiny trinket combining the most valuable of materials.

8816.name: Ancient Gem Necklace
8816.description: A necklace crafted with only using ancient gemstones as well as a super rare white version.

8817.name: Skull Necklace
8817.description: A morbid necklace made from tiny caveling skulls. They're too small to have been children.

8818.name: Eostre Necklace
8818.description: A curved twig holding a golden egg at its end. It is a sign of renewal and fertility.

8819.name: Neptune Necklace
8819.description: A true trinket of the sea, made from kelp and a trident pendant. Mistaking you for a mythic sea ruler, fish come to you more often.

8820.name: Omoroth's Necklace
8820.description: A piece of jewelry with a striking likeness to the sea titan. Wearing it you feel like in tune with the Sunken Sea, enhancing your body in multiple ways.

8821.name: Octarine Necklace
8821.description: A necklace made from pure octarine filled with magic energy.

8822.name: Scarlet Chunk Necklace
8822.description: The scarlet variant of an iron chunk necklace. It raises your defense even more and gives additional benefits.
